snippet: The microblogging company said revenue for the quarter was $243 million, up from $112 million a year ago, and it reported a net loss of $511 million.
abstract: Twitter says its messaging service's challenging design cut rate of new-user growth, and stock falls as much as 18 percent in after-hours trading; reports fourth-quarter loss of $511 million, compared with loss of $8.7 million in year-ago quarter; revenue was $243 million, up 116 percent from $112 million.
lead_paragraph: The microblogging company said revenue for the quarter was $243 million, up from $112 million a year ago, and it reported a net loss of $511 million.

headline.main: User Growth for Twitter Starts to Slow, and Stock Dips
headline.print_headline: User Growth for Twitter Starts to Slow, and Stock Dips
